implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Entry point for the application. Initializes the CLI, which in turn initializes the in-memory service for all data operations.
implementation.name: main
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF command-line arguments are provided:
    Initialize TaskTrackerCLI
    Pass arguments to CLI for processing
ELSE:
    Show help menu

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI component that receives user commands, dispatches them to service methods, and interacts with in-memory data via TaskTrackerService.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerCLI
implementation.pseudo_code:
ON initialization:
    Create TaskTrackerService instance (in-memory data store)
    Map CLI commands to handler methods
ON run(args):
    IF command is valid:
        Call corresponding handler method
    ELSE:
        Show help

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles 'add-user' CLI command. Calls service to create a user in memory.
implementation.name: add_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF args contain name and email:
    Call service.create_user(name, email, role)
    Print user details
ELSE:
    Print usage instructions

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles 'list-users' CLI command. Retrieves all users from in-memory store.
implementation.name: list_users
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call service.get_all_users()
IF users exist:
    Print user details
ELSE:
    Print 'No users found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles 'add-task' CLI command. Calls service to create a task in memory.
implementation.name: add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Parse title, description, priority, due_date from args
Call service.create_task(title, description, priority, due_date)
Print task details

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles 'list-tasks' CLI command. Retrieves all tasks from in-memory store.
implementation.name: list_tasks
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call service.get_all_tasks()
IF tasks exist:
    Print task details
ELSE:
    Print 'No tasks found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Central service managing all users and tasks using in-memory dictionaries. All CRUD and query operations are performed on these in-memory structures.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService
implementation.pseudo_code:
ON initialization:
    self.tasks = {}
    self.users = {}
METHODS:
    create_user: Add User to self.users
    get_user: Retrieve User from self.users
    get_all_users: List all Users from self.users
    update_user: Modify User in self.users
    delete_user: Remove User from self.users and all tasks
    create_task: Add Task to self.tasks
    get_task: Retrieve Task from self.tasks
    get_all_tasks: List all Tasks from self.tasks
    update_task: Modify Task in self.tasks
    delete_task: Remove Task from self.tasks
    assign_task_to_user: Update assignees in Task
    ... (other query/filter methods operate on self.tasks/self.users)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: User model with validation logic in __post_init__. Ensures data integrity for in-memory user objects.
implementation.name: User
implementation.pseudo_code:
ON initialization:
    Generate unique id
    Validate name and email
    Raise error if invalid
METHODS:
    to_dict: Return user as dict

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Task model with logic for assignment, status update, and overdue check. All operations are performed in-memory.
implementation.name: Task
implementation.pseudo_code:
ON initialization:
    Generate unique id
    Validate title
    Raise error if invalid
METHODS:
    assign_user: Add user_id to assignees
    unassign_user: Remove user_id from assignees
    update_status: Change status
    is_overdue: Check if due_date passed and not done
    to_dict: Return task as dict

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command handler for adding a user. Parses arguments, invokes the service layer to create a user, and prints feedback to the user.
implementation.name: add_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF args length < 2
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET name, email, role from args
CALL service.create_user(name, email, role)
PRINT user created message and user details

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Business logic for creating a user. Instantiates a User object, stores in memory, and returns the user.
implementation.name: create_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
CREATE User object with name, email, role
ADD user to users dictionary
RETURN user

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command handler for listing all users. Fetches users from the service and displays them.
implementation.name: list_users
implementation.pseudo_code:
CALL service.get_all_users()
IF no users
    PRINT 'No users found.'
    RETURN
FOR each user in users
    PRINT user details

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Returns all users from in-memory store.
implementation.name: get_all_users
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN list of all users in users dictionary

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command handler for updating user information. Parses arguments, calls service to update, and prints feedback.
implementation.name: update_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF no args
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
PARSE user_id, name, email, role from args
CALL service.update_user(user_id, name, email, role)
IF success
    PRINT 'User updated successfully!'
ELSE
    PRINT 'User not found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates user information in memory. Handles name, email, and role updates.
implementation.name: update_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
GET user by user_id
IF user not found
    RETURN False
IF name provided
    UPDATE user.name
IF email provided
    UPDATE user.email
IF role provided
    UPDATE user.role
RETURN True

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command handler for deleting a user. Calls service to delete and prints feedback.
implementation.name: delete_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF no args
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET user_id from args
CALL service.delete_user(user_id)
IF success
    PRINT 'User deleted successfully!'
ELSE
    PRINT 'User not found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Deletes user from in-memory store and removes user from all assigned tasks.
implementation.name: delete_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF user_id not in users
    RETURN False
FOR each task in tasks
    CALL task.unassign_user(user_id)
DELETE user from users dictionary
RETURN True

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Fetches a user by ID from in-memory store. Used for validation and retrieval.
implementation.name: get_user
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN user from users dictionary by user_id

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides ability to find a user by email, supporting uniqueness and filtering requirements.
implementation.name: find_user_by_email
implementation.pseudo_code:
FOR each user in users dictionary
    IF user.email == email
        RETURN user
RETURN None

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the CLI command for assigning a user to a task. Invokes the service layer to perform assignment and provides feedback. Prints a specific error message if either the task or user is not found.
implementation.name: assign_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF args length < 2:
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET task_id, user_id from args
IF service.assign_task_to_user(task_id, user_id):
    PRINT success message
ELSE:
    PRINT 'Task or user not found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the CLI command for unassigning a user from a task. Invokes the service layer and provides feedback. Prints a specific error message if the task is not found.
implementation.name: unassign_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF args length < 2:
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET task_id, user_id from args
IF service.unassign_task_from_user(task_id, user_id):
    PRINT success message
ELSE:
    PRINT 'Task not found.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the CLI command for reassigning a task to new users. Invokes the service layer and provides feedback. Prints a specific error message if the task is not found or if any user IDs are invalid.
implementation.name: reassign_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF args length < 2:
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET task_id from args[0]
SET user_ids by splitting args[1] by comma
IF service.reassign_task(task_id, user_ids):
    PRINT success message
ELSE:
    PRINT 'Task not found or invalid user IDs.'

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Checks for valid task and user, then assigns the user to the task using the Task model's assign_user method.
implementation.name: assign_task_to_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
GET task by task_id
GET user by user_id
IF task or user not found:
    RETURN False
CALL task.assign_user(user_id)
RETURN True

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Checks for valid task, then unassigns the user from the task using the Task model's unassign_user method.
implementation.name: unassign_task_from_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
GET task by task_id
IF task not found:
    RETURN False
CALL task.unassign_user(user_id)
RETURN True

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Checks for valid task and all user IDs, then replaces the assignees list with new user IDs and updates the timestamp.
implementation.name: reassign_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
GET task by task_id
IF task not found:
    RETURN False
FOR each user_id in new_user_ids:
    IF user_id not in users:
        RETURN False
SET task.assignees = copy of new_user_ids
UPDATE task.updated_at
RETURN True

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Adds a user to the assignees list if not already present and updates the timestamp.
implementation.name: assign_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF user_id not in self.assignees:
    APPEND user_id to self.assignees
    UPDATE self.updated_at

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a user from the assignees list if present and updates the timestamp.
implementation.name: unassign_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF user_id in self.assignees:
    REMOVE user_id from self.assignees
    UPDATE self.updated_at

missing_implementations: No UI component exists for assignment, unassignment, or reassignment actions; only CLI is present.
No explicit feedback for which user IDs are invalid during assignment/reassignment; only a generic error message is shown.
No implementation for assignment actions in a graphical UI (only CLI is present).
No explicit check for duplicate user assignment in reassign (overwrites with provided list, but does not prevent duplicates).
No audit/history of assignment changes; only current assignees are stored.

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command for viewing tasks assigned to a specific user. Invokes service filtering and displays results.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerCLI.view_tasks_by_user
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF no user_id argument
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
user = service.get_user(user_id)
IF user not found
    PRINT 'User not found.'
    RETURN
tasks = service.get_tasks_by_user(user_id)
PRINT header with user info
CALL _display_tasks(tasks)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Filters in-memory tasks by assignee user ID. Used by CLI to implement user-based filtering.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService.get_tasks_by_user
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN [task FOR task IN tasks.values() IF user_id IN task.assignees]

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command for viewing tasks filtered by status. Maps status string to enum, invokes service, displays results.

implementation.pseudo_code:
IF no status argument
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
Map status string to TaskStatus enum
IF invalid status
    PRINT error
    RETURN
tasks = service.get_tasks_by_status(status)
PRINT header with status
CALL _display_tasks(tasks)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Filters in-memory tasks by status. Used by CLI for status-based filtering.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService.get_tasks_by_status
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN [task FOR task IN tasks.values() IF task.status == status]

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command for viewing tasks filtered by priority. Maps priority string to enum, invokes service, displays results.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerCLI.view_tasks_by_priority
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF no priority argument
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
TRY to map priority string to Priority enum
IF invalid priority
    PRINT error
    RETURN
tasks = service.get_tasks_by_priority(priority)
PRINT header with priority
CALL _display_tasks(tasks)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Filters in-memory tasks by priority. Used by CLI for priority-based filtering.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService.get_tasks_by_priority
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN [task FOR task IN tasks.values() IF task.priority == priority]

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command for viewing overdue tasks. Invokes service filtering and displays results.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerCLI.view_overdue_tasks
implementation.pseudo_code:
tasks = service.get_overdue_tasks()
PRINT header
CALL _display_tasks(tasks)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Filters in-memory tasks to find those overdue. Used by CLI for overdue filtering.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService.get_overdue_tasks
implementation.pseudo_code: RETURN [task FOR task IN tasks.values() IF task.is_overdue()]

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Filters in-memory tasks by due date range. Can be used for due date filtering if exposed via CLI.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerService.get_tasks_by_due_date
implementation.pseudo_code:
FOR each task IN tasks.values():
    IF task.due_date is None: CONTINUE
    IF start_date and task.due_date < start_date: CONTINUE
    IF end_date and task.due_date > end_date: CONTINUE
    ADD task to filtered_tasks
RETURN filtered_tasks

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays filtered tasks in CLI. Provides feedback when no tasks match filters.
implementation.name: TaskTrackerCLI._display_tasks
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF tasks is empty
    PRINT 'No tasks found.'
    RETURN
PRINT table header
FOR each task IN tasks
    PRINT task details
PRINT total count

missing_implementations: No UI (web or GUI) component for task viewing or filtering is present.
No CLI command for filtering tasks by due date (get_tasks_by_due_date exists in service, but not exposed in CLI).

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the 'view-by-user' CLI command. Connects to TaskTrackerService.get_tasks_by_user to filter tasks by user.
implementation.name: view_tasks_by_user()
implementation.pseudo_code:
Parse user_id from args
Call service.get_user(user_id)
IF user exists:
    Call service.get_tasks_by_user(user_id)
    Display tasks
ELSE:
    Print 'User not found'

missing_implementations: No graphical or web-based UI is implemented; only CLI is available.
No explicit 'task transfer' feature is present (i.e., moving a task between users as a distinct operation from assignment/reassignment).
No advanced filtering (e.g., by custom criteria, date ranges, or multi-field filters) is exposed in the CLI, except for status, priority, user, and overdue.
No persistent storage; all management is in-memory only.

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: CLI command that allows a user to transfer a task to other users by invoking the reassign_task method. Provides user feedback for success or failure.
implementation.name: reassign-task
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF number of arguments < 2:
    PRINT usage message
    RETURN
SET task_id = first argument
SET user_ids = split second argument by comma
IF service.reassign_task(task_id, user_ids) returns True:
    PRINT success message
ELSE:
    PRINT failure message

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Business logic that updates the assignees of a task, ensuring all user IDs exist and preserving task data integrity.
implementation.name: reassign_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
GET task by task_id
IF task does not exist:
    RETURN False
FOR each user_id in new_user_ids:
    IF user_id not in users:
        RETURN False
SET task.assignees = copy of new_user_ids
UPDATE task.updated_at to now
RETURN True

missing_implementations: No UI component exists for transferring a task between users; only CLI is implemented.
No explicit endpoint for task transfer is present; only service and CLI logic are implemented.
